internal.content:
--- title: Straight-through processing 300-level live demo description: Straight-through processing 300-level live demo tabs: [ 'Demo preparation', 'Demo script'] --- export const Title = () => ( Straight-through processing
300-level live demo ); ![banner](./images/BA_STP_300_Prep_GitHub_banner_8-3-21_short.jpg) | Preparation | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | This demo shows how the IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation enables straight-through processing. To illustrate this, a customer’s refund process is automated.

The capabilities used in this demo are workflow, decisions, and operational intelligence. | | **Demo outline** | Introduction
1. Model workflow
2. Execute workflow without straight-through processing
3. Change the workflow for straight-through processing
4. Execute workflow with straight-through processing
5. Monitor operational intelligence
6. Model decisions
7. Reduce manual work
Summary | | **Before the demo** | **Requisition instructions**

IBM maintains a SaaS environment that can be accessed by IBM employees. Business Partners and IBMers can deploy the solution onto a ROKS environment. At the current time, the SaaS environment is restricted for privacy and confidentiality reasons to employees of IBM.

Select a delivery option:

1. **SaaS**: Using the Cloud Pak for Business Automation as a Service demo environment (likely an IBMer). If you need to request access, follow the instructions [here](https://techzone.ibm.com/collection/5fdfcf8b99cf35001ee4954d). Your environment is pre-deployed.

2. **Self-install**: Install on a TechZone cluster.

• Step 1: Reserve on TechZone. For IBMers and Business Partners with access to TechZone, reserve a Cloud Pak for Automation OpenShift Demo Environment via the [Straight-through processing](https://techzone.ibm.com/collection/5ef5196556dfa7001728cb71#tab-1) TechZone page.

• Step 2: Install the demo. Access the [dba-refund-request](https://github.com/ibm-cloud-architecture/dba-refund-request) GitHub page to read technical architecture information and find deployment instructions.

3. **Self-install**: Install the demo into your own cluster. This is an advanced option. You will need own OpenShift-based cluster with the Cloud Pak for Business Automation installed and configured for access to all the required user interfaces. Access the [dba-refund-request](https://github.com/ibm-cloud-architecture/dba-refund-request) GitHub page to read technical architecture information and find deployment instructions.

Once your environment is ready, continue to the next steps below. | | **Key demo considerations** | Please see [below](#key-demo-considerations). | | **How to get support** | Please direct any questions in preparation for the demo to the [**#Techdemos-Automation-Support**](https://ibm.enterprise.slack.com/app_redirect?channel=techdemos-automation-support) Slack channel. | *** ## Key demo considerations
1 - Open the Refund Request Demo Launchpad - SaaS
Follow these steps for the **SaaS** environment. The Refund Request Demo Launchpad is used to open all the user interfaces used in the demo.
| **1.1 - Access your IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation as a Service tenet.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Note** | Access your IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation as a Service tenet [here](https://www.automationcloud.ibm.com/). Enter your email address.

Steps 1.1.1, 1.1.2, and 1.1.3 are for **technical sellers only**. Most technical sellers initially land in the development environment. If this happens to you, follow these steps to get to the production/runtime environment:
• 1.1.1 - Click on the dropdown menu in the top left corner of the screen.
• 1.1.2 - Click **Deployment** on the left-hand side, and click **Production** to switch to that environment.
• 1.1.3 - On the left-hand side, click **Run**. | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 1.1
![1.1](./images/Stu_1.1.png)

Action 1.1.1 (technical seller only)
![1.1.1_tech_seller](./images/Stu_1.1.1_tech_seller.png)

Action 1.1.2 (technical seller only)
![1.1.2_tech_seller](./images/Stu_1.1.2_tech_seller.png)

Action 1.1.3 (technical seller only)
![1.1.3_tech_seller](./images/Stu_1.1.3_tech_seller.png) | | **1.2 - Click **Business Automation Apps**.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 1.2
![1.2](./images/Stu_1.2.png) | | **1.3 - Click on the **Refund Request** tile.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 1.3
![1.3](./images/Stu_1.3.png) | | **1.4 - The demo launchpad should now appear.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Final screen
![Final screen](./images/Stu_1.4.png) |
**[Go to top](#key-demo-considerations)**
2 - Open the Refund Request Demo Launchpad – Self-install
Follow these steps for **self-installed** environments. The Refund Request Demo Launchpad is used to open all the user interfaces you will use in the demo.
| **2.1 - Open the **Navigator** app. Click on the **Refund Request** tile.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Note** | If you need the URL, open the OCP console under **Workloads** -> **Config Maps**. Locate the **icp4adeploy-cp4ba-access-info** config map. Then, go to the **Navigator** section of the config map to find the URL and add **?desktop=appDesktop1** at the end for the correct desktop. | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 2.1
![2.1](./images/Stu_2.1.png) | | **2.2 - The demo launchpad should now appear.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Final screen
![Final screen](./images/Stu_2.2.png) |
**[Go to top](#key-demo-considerations)**
3 - Open the process diagram for refund request without straight-through processing inside Workflow Process Designer
Open a browser tab with **Workflow Process Designer** and open the **Refund Request without Straight-through Processing** process diagram.
| **3.1 - Go to the **Refund Request Demo Launcher** and click **Process Analyst**.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 3.1
![3.1](./images/Stu_3.1.png) | | **3.2 - Use the provided URL to open **Business Automation Studio** in a new tab.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 3.2
![3.2](./images/Stu_3.2.png) | | **3.3 - From the top left-hand menu, select **Design** and then **Business Automations**.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 3.3
![3.3](./images/Stu_3.3.png) | | **3.4 - From the **Business Automations** page, select **Workflow**.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 3.4
![3.4](./images/Stu_3.4.png) | | **3.5 - Within the **Refund Request** tile, select **Open**.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 3.5
![3.5](./images/Stu_3.5.png) | | **3.6 - Inside the **Process App**, select **Processes**, and then select **Refund Request without STP**.** | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 3.6
![3.6](./images/Stu_3.6.png) | | **3.7 - The **Refund Request without STP** process diagram will open.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Note** | This will be the tab to display when you start the demo. | | **Screenshot** |  
Final screen
![Final screen](./images/Stu_3.7.png) |
**[Go to top](#key-demo-considerations)**
4 - Open task list and populate some in-flight tasks
Open the task list view in a new tab (**SaaS Process Portal** is used since Workplace is not yet available on SaaS).

Also, populate some in-flight process instances, so there are some tasks in the inbox. Note: The tasks will be automatically deleted after 12 hours to keep things clean for other users.
| **4.1 - Go to the **Refund Request Demo Launcher** and click on the **Refund Investigator**.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 4.1
![4.1](./images/Stu_4.1.png) | | **4.2 - The task list view will open in a new tab.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Note** | The task list view will open in a new tab as follows:
• 4.2.1 (**Saas**) - Process Portal will open in a new tab (the new Workplace is not yet available on SaaS).
• 4.2.2 (**Self-install**) - Workplace will open in a new tab. | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 4.2.1 (SaaS)
![4.2.1 (SaaS)](./images/Stu_4.2.1_SaaS.png)

Action 4.2.2 (Self-install)
![4.2.2 (Self-install)](./images/Stu_4.2.2_Self_Install.png) | | **4.3 (**SaaS**) - Populate some in-flight tasks from **Process Portal**.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Note** | Populate some in-flight tasks from **Process Portal**:
• 4.3.1 (**SaaS**) - Under **Launch**, click on **Request Refund**. Click **three times** to generate three new tasks.
• 4.3.2 (**SaaS**) - Under **Launch**, click on **Quote Exception**. Click **two times** to generate two new tasks.
• 4.3.3 (**SaaS**) - You should now see (at least) five tasks in the task inbox. | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 4.3.1 (SaaS)
![4.3.1 (SaaS)](./images/Stu_4.3.1_SaaS.png)

Action 4.3.2 (SaaS)
![4.3.2 (SaaS)](./images/Stu_4.3.2_SaaS.png)

Action 4.3.3 (SaaS)
![4.3.3 (SaaS)](./images/Stu_4.3.3_SaaS.png) | | **4.4 (**Self-install**) - Populate some in-flight tasks from Workplace.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Action** | Populate some in-flight tasks from **Workplace**:
• 4.4.1 (**Self-install**) - From **Workplace**, click on **Start Workflow**.
• 4.4.2 (**Self-install**) - Select the **Refund Request** tile (may need to scroll down). Then, select Tip. Then, select **Launch**. Repeat **three times** to generate three tasks.
• 4.4.3 (**Self-install**) - Click on **Start Workflow**, Select the **Quote Exception** tile (may need to scroll down). Then, select **Tip**. Then, select **Launch**. Repeat **two times** to generate two tasks.
• 4.4.4 (**Self-install**) - You should now see (at least) five tasks in the task inbox. | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 4.4.1 (Self-install)
![4.4.1 (Self-install)](./images/Stu_4.4.1_Self_Install.png)

Action 4.4.2 (Self-install)
![4.4.2 (Self-install)](./images/Stu_4.4.2_Self_Install.png)

Action 4.4.3 (Self-install)
![4.4.3 (Self-install)](./images/Stu_4.4.3_Self_install.png)

Action 4.4.4 (Self-install)
![4.4.4 (Self-install)](./images/Stu_4.4.4_Self_install.png) |
**[Go to top](#key-demo-considerations)**
5 - Open Refund Request Dashboard
Open the **Refund Request Dashboard** in a new tab.
| **5.1 - Go to the **Demo Launcher**, and click on the **Business Analyst**.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 5.1
![5.1](./images/Stu_5.1.png) | | **5.2 - From the **BAI Dashboards** page, click on the **Refund Request (RR) Week1** dashboard.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 5.2
![5.2](./images/Stu_5.2.png) | | **5.3 - The **Refund Request (RR) - Week 1** dashboard will open.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Final screen
![Final screen](./images/Stu_5.3.png) |
**[Go to top](#key-demo-considerations)**
6 - Open Decision Center
Open **Decision Center** in a new tab.
| **6.1 - Go to the **Demo Launcher** and click on the **Rules Manager**.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 6.1
![6.1](./images/Stu_6.1.png) | | **6.2 - **Decision Center** will open in a new tab.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Final screen
![Final screen](./images/Stu_6.2_.png) |
**[Go to top](#key-demo-considerations)**
7 - Open the Focus Corp - Your Returns and Refunds page
Open the **Focus Corp - Your Returns and Refunds** page in a new tab. This is where you will show submitting the refund requests.
| **7.1 - Go to the **Demo Launcher**, and click on the **Customer**.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Action 7.1
![7.1](./images/Stu_7.1.png) | | **7.2 - Open the **Focus Corp - Your Returns and Refunds** page.** | | | :--- | :--- | | **Screenshot** |  
Final screen
![Final screen](./images/Stu_7.2.png) |
**[Go to top](#key-demo-considerations)**
***
